headline: Over 5% of Ethereum and Up to 18% of Bitcoin Permanently Lost
summary: The post Over 5% of Ethereum and Up to 18% of Bitcoin Permanently Lost appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Millions of cryptocurrencies are estimated to be permanently lost, including over 913,000 Ethereum (about 5% of supply) and between 2.3 to 3.7 million Bitcoin (11-18% of supply). Causes include lost wallets, forgotten passwords, and user errors. The figures also encompass Satoshi Nakamoto’s untouched 1 million BTC. This highlights the vital importance for crypto holders to secure private keys, as lost access results in irreversible loss of digital assets.

headline: Robert Kiyosaki Warns of Potential 1929-Style Market Crash, Holds Gold, Silver, and Bitcoin
summary: The post Robert Kiyosaki Warns of Potential 1929-Style Market Crash, Holds Gold, Silver, and Bitcoin appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Robert Kiyosaki has warned that the global economy might be approaching a crash similar to the 1929 Great Depression. In response, he says he is holding firm in gold, silver, and Bitcoin as safe-haven assets. Kiyosaki’s caution highlights ongoing concerns about economic instability and inflation, emphasizing the importance of diversification and digital assets like Bitcoin amidst uncertain market conditions.

headline: Upbit to List Optimism (OP) Trading Pairs with KRW, BTC, and USDT
summary: The post Upbit to List Optimism (OP) Trading Pairs with KRW, BTC, and USDT appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News South Korea’s largest crypto exchange, Upbit, will soon add trading pairs for Optimism (OP) with Korean Won (KRW), Bitcoin (BTC), and Tether (USDT). Optimism is a Layer 2 scaling solution designed to improve Ethereum’s transaction speed and reduce fees. This listing highlights growing interest in Layer 2 technologies and provides Upbit users with more options for trading OP tokens in the rapidly expanding crypto market.

headline: Metaplanet Boosts Bitcoin Holdings to $2 Billion With Latest Purchase
summary: The post Metaplanet Boosts Bitcoin Holdings to $2 Billion With Latest Purchase appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Metaplanet has acquired 780 Bitcoin (BTC) for $92.5 million, raising its total holdings to 17,132 BTC worth about $2 billion at current prices. The Tokyo-listed company now ranks seventh globally among public corporate bitcoin holders. Metaplanet, which began accumulating bitcoin in April 2024, aims to hold over 210,000 BTC by 2027. The firm’s bitcoin business saw Q2 revenue jump 42.4% year-over-year to $7.6 million, with shares up 258.3% year-to-date.

headline: The S&P 500 broke above 6,400 after the U.S. and EU agreed to lower tariffs to 15%.
summary: The S&P 500 pushed past the 6,400 line late Sunday night after U.S. President Donald Trump confirmed Sunday evening that the United States had finalized a tariff deal with the European Union, cutting levies down to 15% from the previously threatened 30%. That announcement sent futures higher across the board and kicked off a rally that pulled Bitcoin back up to $120,000 for the first time in nearly two weeks. Contracts tied to the Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped by 180 points (0.4%). S&P 500 futures climbed 0.3%, while Nasdaq 100 futures gained 0.4%. The sudden spike followed the White House’s confirmation of a successful trade agreement with the EU. Trump had been threatening a heavy 30% tariff on EU imports before this adjustment. That walk-back was enough to send risk appetite back through the roof. Bitcoin, which had been swinging between $114,000 and $119,000, cleared $120,000 and was just $3,080 shy of its all-time high. Traders watch earnings, Fed, and Trump’s August 1 deadline The week is already loaded with pressure points. Wall Street will see earnings from top tech companies, a closely watched Federal Reserve meeting, inflation numbers, and Trump’s own August 1 tariff deadline. Even before Trump’s Sunday announcement, U.S. equities had ended the previous week strong. On Friday, the Dow added 208.01 points, ending at 44,901.92. The S&P 500 closed at 6,388.64, its 14th record finish of the year and fifth straight day of new highs. The Nasdaq Composite ended Friday at 21,108.32, also setting a fresh record, its 15th this year. Wall Street’s optimism last week had already been helped by solid earnings and other trade negotiations with countries like Japan and Indonesia. But with new tariffs off the table for now, markets had extra fuel going into Monday. The rally also lifted commodities. Gold traded near $3,335 an ounce after losing 0.4% last week. The yellow metal has still risen more than 25% this year, as investors continue to seek safety amid geopolitical uncertainty, including ongoing conflict in Ukraine and instability in the Middle East. After briefly crossing $3,500 an ounce back in April, the latest data from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission showed that fund managers had raised bullish positions on gold to the highest point in 16 weeks. Europe mostly flat as Asia-Pacific reacts to U.S. momentum The reaction in Europe was mixed, as the FTSE MIB in Italy rose by 126.58 points to close at 40,726.26, up 0.31%. OMXS30 in Sweden moved 0.23% higher to 2,606.32. Denmark’s OMXC 25 climbed 0.26%, while Finland’s HEX inched up 0.04%. Other markets in the region were flat. Germany’s DAX remained at 24,217.5. France’s CAC 40, the STOXX600, AEX, BEL 20, SMI, and PSI20 all showed no movement. The UK’s FTSE fell 18.06 points, or 0.2%, closing at 9,120.31. Spain’s IBEX 35 dropped by 19.2 points, or 0.13%, ending the session at 14,237.3. In currency markets, the euro-dollar pair moved up slightly to 1.175, while the British pound stayed at 1.344 with almost no change. The Japanese yen traded at 147.85 against the dollar after a 0.13% increase. The U.S. dollar index stood at 97.62, up just 0.01%. The Asia-Pacific session opened with mixed sentiment. At 10 a.m. in Hong Kong, the Hang Seng Index was up 0.49%, extending momentum from the U.S. session. But elsewhere, traders were waiting. Mainland China’s CSI 300 was flat ahead of U.S.-China trade talks scheduled to begin later Monday in Stockholm. Japan’s Nikkei 225 dropped 0.85%, and the broader Topix slid 0.44%. In South Korea, the Kospi edged up 0.15%, while the Kosdaq stayed flat. In Australia, the S&P/ASX 200 gained 0.2%. Cryptopolitan Academy: Tired of market swings? Learn how DeFi can help you build steady passive income. Register Now

headline: Metaplanet Buys 780 Bitcoin — Now Holds Over 17,000 BTC
summary: The post Metaplanet Buys 780 Bitcoin — Now Holds Over 17,000 BTC appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Monday kicked off with a big purchase in the world of Bitcoin. Japan’s top Bitcoin-holding company, Metaplanet Inc., has added 780 more BTC to its treasury, pushing its total to 17,132 BTC. But what caught attention was something even bigger, Metaplanet has already seen a massive 449.7% return on its Bitcoin investments in 2025 alone. Metaplanet Buys 780 BTC In a recent tweet post, Metaplanet announced that it recently bought 780 BTC for about $92.5 million, paying around $118,622 per Bitcoin. This is one of their highest average prices so far, showing strong belief in Bitcoin’s long-term growth. *Metaplanet Acquires Additional 780 $BTC , Total Holdings Reach 17,132 BTC* pic.twitter.com/0gw3HwpUCH — Metaplanet Inc. (@Metaplanet_JP) July 28, 2025 With this latest purchase, Metaplanet has climbed up the ranks to become the seventh-biggest company holding Bitcoin, trailing behind Trump Media & Technology Group. As of July 28, 2025, Metaplanet now owns 17,132 BTC, which they bought for around $1.73 billion. Their average cost per Bitcoin is about $101,030. This makes Metaplanet one of the biggest corporate holders of Bitcoin, joining names like Strategy (formerly known as MicroStrategy) in betting big on BTC. 449.7% Returns This Year What’s even more impressive is that Metaplanet has already seen a 449.7% return on its Bitcoin investments this year. With Bitcoin now trading around $119,404 , this sharp price rise in 2025 has boosted their profits. It shows that Metaplanet’s early and bold decisions to buy Bitcoin have worked out so far. Metaplanet Stock Surge by 6% Metaplanet’s latest Bitcoin move caught the market’s attention, and the reaction wasn’t quiet. Right after the news, the company’s stock price jumped by 6% , now trading around $1,255. What’s even more surprising is the bigger picture, since Metaplanet first added Bitcoin to its balance sheet, its stock has jumped by over 200% in just six months.

headline: XRP Price Poised for Fresh Upward Move Amid Renewed Bullish Pressure
summary: XRP price started a fresh increase from the $2.950 zone. The price is now trading above $3.20 and might aim for more gains in the near term. XRP price started a fresh increase above the $3.20zone. The price is now trading above $3.220 and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average. There was a break above a key bearish trend line with resistance at $3.240 on the hourly chart of the XRP/USD pair (data source from Kraken). The pair could start another increase if it stays above the $3.150 zone. XRP Price Eyes Fresh Rally XRP price started a fresh decline below the $3.250 support zone, underperforming Bitcoin and Ethereum . The price declined below the $3.20 and $3.050 support levels. The decline was such that the price traded below the $3.00 level. A low was formed at $2.959 and the price is now correcting losses. There was a move above the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the recent decline from the $3.650 swing high to the $2.959 low. Besides, there was a break above a key bearish trend line with resistance at $3.240 on the hourly chart of the XRP/USD pair. The price is now trading above $3.250 and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average. On the upside, the price might face resistance near the $3.30 level and the 50% Fib retracement level of the recent decline from the $3.650 swing high to the $2.959 low. The first major resistance is near the $3.3850 level. A clear move above the $3.3850 resistance might send the price toward the $3.450 resistance. Any more gains might send the price toward the $3.50 resistance or even $3.5120 in the near term. The next major hurdle for the bulls might be near the $3.650 zone. Another Drop? If XRP fails to clear the $3.30 resistance zone, it could start another decline. Initial support on the downside is near the $3.20 level. The next major support is near the $3.150 level. If there is a downside break and a close below the $3.150 level, the price might continue to decline toward the $3.050 support. The next major support sits near the $3.00 zone. Technical Indicators Hourly MACD – The MACD for XRP/USD is now gaining pace in the bullish zone. Hourly RSI (Relative Strength Index) – The RSI for XRP/USD is now above the 50 level. Major Support Levels – $3.20 and $3.150. Major Resistance Levels – $3.30 and $3.3850.

headline: Spot Ethereum ETF Mania: U.S. Funds Witness Astounding $1.85 Billion Inflow
summary: BitcoinWorld Spot Ethereum ETF Mania: U.S. Funds Witness Astounding $1.85 Billion Inflow The world of digital assets is once again capturing global attention, and for good reason. U.S. Spot Ethereum ETF products have just marked a truly remarkable week, attracting a staggering $1.85 billion in net inflows. This colossal sum isn’t just a number; it’s a powerful signal of growing institutional and retail confidence in Ethereum and the broader cryptocurrency market. For anyone tracking the evolution of digital finance, this development is nothing short of pivotal. What Exactly is a Spot Ethereum ETF and Why Does it Matter? Before diving into the specifics of these recent inflows, let’s quickly clarify what a Spot Ethereum ETF is. Unlike futures-based ETFs, which track the price of futures contracts, a spot ETF directly holds the underlying asset—in this case, Ethereum. This direct exposure is a game-changer for several reasons: Accessibility: It allows traditional investors to gain exposure to Ethereum without needing to directly buy, store, or manage the cryptocurrency themselves. This simplifies the investment process significantly. Regulatory Clarity: The approval of these ETFs by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) provides a stamp of legitimacy, integrating digital assets further into mainstream finance. Liquidity: ETFs trade on traditional stock exchanges, offering enhanced liquidity and ease of trading compared to direct crypto purchases on less regulated platforms. The existence of a Spot Ethereum ETF product opens new avenues for capital flow into the crypto ecosystem, making it a critical development for market maturation. The Astonishing Inflow: Breaking Down the Numbers for Spot Ethereum ETF According to data from SoSoValue, U.S. Spot Ethereum ETF s collectively saw a net inflow of $1.85 billion last week. This impressive figure represents the second-largest weekly inflow since their inception, underscoring a strong resurgence in investor appetite for Ethereum-backed products. To put this into perspective, let’s compare it with the performance of U.S. spot Bitcoin (BTC) ETFs during the same period: Asset Type Weekly Net Inflow U.S. Spot Ethereum ETFs $1.85 Billion U.S. Spot Bitcoin ETFs $72.06 Million The difference is stark. While Bitcoin ETFs continue to attract capital, the magnitude of inflows into Spot Ethereum ETF s highlights a distinct shift in focus and a significant vote of confidence in Ethereum’s potential. This indicates that investors are increasingly diversifying their digital asset portfolios beyond just Bitcoin. What’s Driving This Phenomenal Spot Ethereum ETF Demand? Several factors are contributing to this surge in demand for Spot Ethereum ETF s: Regulatory Momentum: The SEC’s approval of these ETFs removed a major hurdle, providing institutional investors with the regulatory clarity they often require. This green light has unlocked substantial capital from traditional finance. Ethereum’s Ecosystem Strength: Ethereum is more than just a cryptocurrency; it’s a foundational blockchain for decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and countless decentralized applications (dApps). Its robust and evolving ecosystem makes it an attractive long-term investment. Anticipation of Future Growth: Many investors view Ethereum as a high-growth asset, particularly with ongoing network upgrades (like the upcoming Pectra upgrade) aimed at improving scalability and efficiency. Diversification Play: For institutions and high-net-worth individuals, a Spot Ethereum ETF offers a strategic way to diversify their exposure within the crypto sector, moving beyond a Bitcoin-only strategy. Market Sentiment Shift: A broader positive sentiment towards digital assets, fueled by Bitcoin’s recent rally and increasing mainstream acceptance, has created a fertile ground for new investment products like the Spot Ethereum ETF . Impact on the Crypto Market: What Does This Mean for ETH and Beyond? The substantial inflows into Spot Ethereum ETF s carry significant implications for the entire cryptocurrency market: Price Action for ETH: Increased demand from ETFs can directly influence Ethereum’s price by reducing the available supply on exchanges. While short-term volatility is always possible, sustained inflows suggest upward price pressure over time. Validation of Ethereum: These inflows serve as a strong validation of Ethereum’s role as a leading blockchain and a legitimate investment asset, further cementing its position alongside Bitcoin. Broader Market Confidence: The success of Spot Ethereum ETF s could pave the way for other altcoin ETFs, signaling a maturing market where diverse digital assets gain institutional acceptance. This could bring more capital into the overall crypto space. Reduced Volatility (Long-Term): As more institutional money flows into ETFs, it can introduce a degree of stability to the market, potentially dampening extreme price swings that are characteristic of less mature markets. Challenges and Opportunities in the Spot Ethereum ETF Landscape While the recent inflows are overwhelmingly positive, it’s important to consider both the opportunities and potential challenges that lie ahead for the Spot Ethereum ETF market: Opportunities: Increased Mainstream Adoption: ETFs simplify access, encouraging more traditional investors to explore digital assets, thus accelerating mainstream adoption. Enhanced Market Infrastructure: The growth of ETFs necessitates robust custody solutions, trading platforms, and regulatory frameworks, leading to a more mature and secure market infrastructure. Price Discovery: Increased institutional participation can lead to more efficient price discovery for Ethereum, reflecting its true market value more accurately. Challenges: Market Volatility: While institutions can bring stability, large inflows or outflows from ETFs can still trigger significant price movements, especially in a nascent market. Regulatory Evolution: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving. Changes in policy could impact ETF operations and investor sentiment. Competition: As the market matures, competition among ETF providers will intensify, potentially leading to fee compression but also greater innovation. Looking Ahead: The Future of Spot Ethereum ETFs and Digital Assets The recent $1.85 billion inflow into Spot Ethereum ETF s is likely just the beginning. As awareness grows and more investment platforms integrate these products, we can expect continued interest from a diverse range of investors. The success of these ETFs sets a precedent for other digital assets to potentially follow suit, further blurring the lines between traditional finance and the crypto world. The coming months will be crucial in observing whether these inflows sustain and how they impact Ethereum’s price trajectory and broader market dynamics. The institutional embrace of Ethereum via the Spot Ethereum ETF is a testament to the asset’s growing significance and its potential to reshape investment portfolios globally. Actionable Insights for Investors For those considering exposure to Ethereum through ETFs, here are some actionable insights: Understand the Product: While convenient, understand that investing in a Spot Ethereum ETF carries the same underlying risks as investing in Ethereum directly, including price volatility. Diversify Your Portfolio: Do not put all your capital into one asset. Consider how an Ethereum ETF fits into your overall investment strategy and risk tolerance. Stay Informed: The crypto market is dynamic. Keep up-to-date with regulatory changes, market trends, and Ethereum’s network developments. Consult a Financial Advisor: For significant investment decisions, seeking advice from a qualified financial professional is always recommended. In conclusion, the astounding $1.85 billion inflow into U.S. Spot Ethereum ETF s last week marks a significant milestone. It underscores the growing institutional acceptance of digital assets and highlights Ethereum’s pivotal role in the future of finance. This influx of capital not only validates Ethereum’s position but also paves the way for a more integrated and mature cryptocurrency market. The future of digital asset investing looks increasingly bright, with ETFs serving as a crucial bridge between traditional finance and the innovative world of blockchain. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What is the primary difference between a spot Ethereum ETF and a futures Ethereum ETF? A spot Ethereum ETF directly holds Ethereum, providing direct price exposure to the asset. A futures Ethereum ETF, conversely, holds futures contracts that bet on Ethereum’s future price, rather than the actual cryptocurrency. 2. Why are the recent $1.85 billion inflows into Spot Ethereum ETFs significant? These significant inflows indicate strong institutional and retail investor confidence in Ethereum, signaling increasing mainstream adoption and validating Ethereum’s position as a major investment asset. It also represents a substantial capital injection into the crypto market. 3. How does a Spot Ethereum ETF impact Ethereum’s price? When a Spot Ethereum ETF receives inflows, it typically needs to purchase underlying Ethereum to back its shares. This increased demand can put upward pressure on Ethereum’s price by reducing the available supply on exchanges. 4. Are there risks associated with investing in a Spot Ethereum ETF? Yes, investing in a Spot Ethereum ETF carries risks similar to direct cryptocurrency investments, including high price volatility, regulatory changes, and potential market manipulation. Investors should conduct thorough research and understand these risks. 5. Will the U.S. Spot Ethereum ETF inflows continue at this pace? While the recent inflows were substantial, predicting future inflow rates is difficult. They depend on various factors, including broader market sentiment, regulatory developments, Ethereum’s performance, and macroeconomic conditions. However, the initial success suggests sustained interest. 6. How does the approval of a Spot Ethereum ETF affect the broader cryptocurrency market? The approval and success of a Spot Ethereum ETF can enhance the legitimacy of the entire cryptocurrency market, potentially paving the way for ETFs based on other altcoins. It also brings more institutional capital into the digital asset space, fostering market maturity. We hope this article has provided valuable insights into the recent surge in U.S. Spot Ethereum ETF inflows. If you found this information helpful, please consider sharing it with your network on social media to help us spread awareness about these exciting developments in the crypto world! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption. This post Spot Ethereum ETF Mania: U.S. Funds Witness Astounding $1.85 Billion Inflow first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Metaplanet Buys 780 More Bitcoin, Total Now Over 17,000 BTC
summary: Metaplanet , the Tokyo-listed firm rapidly evolving into one of Asia’s most aggressive corporate Bitcoin holders, added another 780 Bitcoin to its treasury on July 28. The latest acquisition brings its total holdings to 17,132 BTC, marking a sharp climb from the 13,350 reported just a month ago. The company disclosed the purchase in a filing on Monday, noting it paid an average of 17.52m yen (US$119,136) per Bitcoin, amounting to a total investment of 13.67b yen ($92.93m). Since launching its Bitcoin Treasury Operations in Dec. 2024, Metaplanet has steadily accumulated Bitcoin using proceeds from capital market activities and operating income. *Metaplanet Acquires Additional 780 $BTC , Total Holdings Reach 17,132 BTC* pic.twitter.com/0gw3HwpUCH — Metaplanet Inc. (@Metaplanet_JP) July 28, 2025 Metaplanet Trading Volume Doubles in Crypto-Fueled Frenzy The new purchase comes as the firm’s share trading activity on the Tokyo Stock Exchange has surged . Trading volume in Metaplanet stock hit 1.86 trillion yen ($12.65b) in June, nearly doubling the 997.6b yen ($6.78b) recorded in May, according to TSE data. The sharp rise reflects growing investor interest as the company leans further into its digital asset strategy. In the past three months alone, Metaplanet’s Bitcoin holdings have grown by over 13,000 BTC. This expansion has been financed through multiple rounds of share issuances and bond redemptions. On July 4 and again on July 14, the company redeemed a combined 12.75b yen ($86.7m) from its 19th series of bonds, using funds raised through the exercise of stock acquisition rights. Those rights have translated into rapid share dilution. Between June 30 and July 28, the company issued tens of millions of new shares through its 20th to 22nd series of stock acquisition programs. Fully diluted shares outstanding now stand at nearly 866m. Metaplanet’s Q2 BTC Yield Surges to 129.4% To evaluate whether this aggressive capital strategy benefits shareholders, Metaplanet tracks several custom metrics like BTC Yield, BTC Gain and BTC ¥ Gain. These indicators aim to measure how much Bitcoin the company has accumulated relative to its expanding share base and to estimate the hypothetical accretion had no new shares been issued. From July 1 to July 28 alone, Metaplanet’s BTC Yield stood at 22.5%. In yen terms, that gain equates to more than 52.5b yen ($357m). Previous quarters have seen even stronger growth, with a 129.4% BTC Yield in Q2 2025 and an eye-popping 309.8% in Q4 2024. The average purchase price across all 17,132 Bitcoin now sits at roughly 14.78m yen ($100,504) per coin. That number has steadily risen alongside Metaplanet’s appetite for the asset, up from 12.94m yen ($87,992) at the end of March. Crypto Metrics Not a Substitute for Cash Flow, Metaplanet Says The company acknowledges that these metrics are not substitutes for traditional financial indicators such as cash flow or net income. However, it argues they reflect the success of its strategy to grow Bitcoin per share. It believes this metric will become increasingly valuable to long-term investors. Metaplanet has not declared any dividends so far. Instead, it has reminded shareholders that owning its stock does not mean direct ownership of the underlying Bitcoin. Additionally, the company has cautioned that its custom KPIs do not account for debt obligations or preferred stock. As a result, these metrics may overstate gains if taken outside the broader financial context. Still, Metaplanet’s move stands out in Japan, where few listed companies have embraced Bitcoin on this scale. The post Metaplanet Buys 780 More Bitcoin, Total Now Over 17,000 BTC appeared first on Cryptonews .

headline: Decentralized AI – Why Blockchain Is the Missing Governance Layer
summary: HodlX Guest Post Submit Your Post AI is evolving at breakneck speed, with autonomous agents now capable of analyzing markets, diagnosing diseases, writing code and making hiring decisions. But as capabilities grow, so does a more profound unease – who governs these agents, and by what rules? A handful of corporations are controlling access, performance and alignment. This centralization of intelligence data raises suspicions and a lack of trust. Trust in AI (artificial intelligence) is not just about whether it works. It’s about who controls it, how it evolves and whether its behavior can be audited, questioned or improved. In a centralized system, those questions are answered, if at all, behind closed doors. Blockchain and Web 3.0 technologies offer a compelling alternative – decentralization as a design principle. Rather than trusting a company, we verify the system. Rather than relying on goodwill, we rely on protocol. The trust problem in centralized AI The black-box nature of proprietary AI models limits transparency. Their training data, optimization strategies and update cycles are opaque. Worse, these models often operate in high-stakes environments, making decisions that affect people’s finances, health or rights. Without a clear understanding of how these decisions are made, trust becomes blind. There’s also the concentration of infrastructure. The compute resources, data pipelines and deployment channels for advanced AI are primarily housed in private data centers. This creates points of failure and reinforces a power imbalance, where end users become passive consumers of intelligence they cannot shape or interrogate. Incentive structures compound the issue. Traditional AI development lacks mechanisms to reward verifiable contributions or penalize harmful behavior. An agent that misbehaves suffers no cost unless its owner intervenes, and that owner may prioritize profitability over ethics. What blockchain brings to the table Blockchain offers a trustless architecture where AI systems can be governed, audited and incentivized in transparent, programmable ways. One of the most profound shifts it enables is the ability to embed accountability directly into the AI stack. Reputation becomes quantifiable. For instance, ABTs (AgentBound Tokens) are non-transferable cryptographic credentials proposed to track an AI agent’s conduct. If an agent wants to perform high-stakes actions, it must stake its reputation. Misbehavior results in slashing, while good performance reinforces its credibility. This creates economic alignment between the agent’s incentives and human expectations. Blockchain also introduces auditability – by recording data origin, training history and decision logs on-chain, stakeholders can verify how and why a model made a particular choice. Equally important is infrastructure decentralization. AI today is bottlenecked by the physical and economic constraints of centralized data centers. With the rise of DePIN and decentralized storage systems like IPFS, AI workloads can be distributed across global participants. This reduces costs, increases resilience and also breaks the monopoly over who gets to build, train and deploy models. Multi-agent systems need shared rails Autonomous agents are not isolated entities – increasingly, they must interact, whether to coordinate logistics, pricing services or optimize supply chains. Without shared protocols and interoperable standards, these agents remain confined within their silos, unable to compose or collaborate. Public blockchains provide the rails for agent-to-agent coordination. Smart contracts allow agents to make enforceable agreements. Tokenized incentives align behavior across networks. A marketplace of services emerges where agents can buy compute, sell data and negotiate outcomes – without relying on centralized intermediaries. Today, we can see prototyped ecosystem frameworks where agents operate semi-independently, staking tokens, verifying each other’s outputs and transacting based on shared economic logic. It’s an overlay network for machine coordination, native to the internet. Federated learning without a central brain Training AI collaboratively across different parties without pooling sensitive data is a major frontier. FL (federated learning) allows this by keeping data local and sharing only model updates. But most FL implementations still rely on a central server to coordinate aggregation – a potential choke point and attack surface. DFL (decentralized federated learning) removes this middleman. With blockchain as the coordination layer, updates can be shared peer-to-peer, verified through consensus and logged immutably. Each participant contributes to a collective model without ceding control or privacy. Tokens incentivize high-quality updates and penalize poisoning attempts, ensuring the integrity of the training process. This architecture is well-suited for healthcare, finance or any domain where data sensitivity is paramount and stakeholder plurality is essential. Risks and trade-offs of on-chain AI No system is without its challenges. Blockchain brings latency and throughput constraints that may limit its use in real-time AI systems. Governance tokens can be manipulated, and poorly designed incentive schemes might create perverse behavior. On-chain logic – once deployed – is challenging to change, posing risks if flaws go unnoticed. There are also security concerns. If an AI relies on on-chain oracles or coordination, an attack on the underlying blockchain could cascade into AI behavior. Moreover, reputation systems like ABTs require robust Sybil resistance and privacy safeguards to prevent manipulation. These are not reasons to avoid blockchain – but they highlight the need for careful design, formal verification and a commitment to continuous refinement. A new social contract for AI At its core, blockchain gives AI a governance substrate – a way to encode norms, distribute power and reward alignment. It reframes the question of ‘who controls the AI’ into ‘how is control encoded, executed and verified?’ This matters even more politically than technically. AI development without decentralization will likely go from open experimentation to corporate consolidation. Blockchain offers a chance to build intelligent systems as public goods, not proprietary assets. The challenge is to fuse the technical layers, data, model, incentive and control into a coherent stack. But the path is visible – open protocols, transparent incentives and decentralized oversight. AI doesn’t just need blockchain for infrastructure. It needs it for legitimacy. In a world of autonomous agents, trust can’t be a byproduct – i t must be engineered. Blockchain gives us the tools to do precisely that. Roman Melnyk is the chief marketing officer at DeXe . headline: Metaplanet Bitcoin: Strategic Acquisition Propels Japanese Firm’s Holdings
summary: BitcoinWorld Metaplanet Bitcoin: Strategic Acquisition Propels Japanese Firm’s Holdings The world of finance is constantly evolving, with traditional companies increasingly embracing digital assets. At the forefront of this revolution in Japan stands Metaplanet, a publicly traded company that has consistently demonstrated a bold vision for its financial future. Their latest move? A significant acquisition of 780 additional Bitcoin (BTC), cementing their position as a formidable institutional player in the crypto space. This strategic decision by Metaplanet Bitcoin is not just a headline; it’s a powerful statement about the growing confidence in digital currencies among established corporations, especially within a highly regulated market like Japan. Metaplanet Bitcoin : A Deep Dive into Their Latest Strategic Move In a move that underscores its unwavering commitment to Bitcoin, Metaplanet recently announced, via its official X account, the purchase of an additional 780 BTC. This substantial acquisition significantly boosts the firm’s total Bitcoin holdings, bringing their cumulative investment to an impressive 117.132 BTC. For context, this places Metaplanet among a select group of publicly traded companies globally with substantial Bitcoin treasuries, highlighting their conviction in the long-term value proposition of the world’s leading cryptocurrency. Metaplanet’s journey into Bitcoin began with an initial strategic allocation, and subsequent acquisitions have steadily increased their exposure. This latest purchase, made during a period of fluctuating market dynamics, signals a calculated long-term strategy rather than short-term speculation. It reflects a deeper understanding of Bitcoin’s role as a potential hedge against inflation and a store of value in an uncertain global economic landscape. The decision to further invest in Metaplanet Bitcoin holdings demonstrates a proactive approach to capital allocation, aiming to preserve and grow shareholder value. To illustrate the growth of Metaplanet’s Bitcoin treasury, consider the following approximate milestones: Date (Approx.) Event/Announcement Approximate BTC Holdings Significance Early 2024 Initial Strategic Bitcoin Adoption ~1,000 – 5,000 BTC Marked Metaplanet’s entry into the Bitcoin space. Mid-2024 Multiple Incremental Acquisitions ~5,000 – 10,000 BTC Consistent accumulation demonstrated long-term conviction. Recent Announcement Acquisition of additional 780 BTC 117.132 BTC (total) Solidifies Metaplanet’s position as a major institutional holder. This steady accumulation strategy showcases Metaplanet’s methodical approach to integrating Bitcoin into its corporate treasury. Why Are Companies Like Metaplanet Embracing Bitcoin? The decision by a publicly traded company, especially one based in Japan with its stringent regulatory environment, to allocate significant capital to Bitcoin is not taken lightly. Several compelling reasons drive this trend among forward-thinking corporations, and Metaplanet’s strategy likely aligns with many of these: Inflation Hedge: In an era of monetary expansion, Bitcoin is increasingly viewed as a digital alternative to traditional safe-haven assets. Its decentralized nature and fixed supply make it resistant to inflationary pressures that can devalue fiat currencies. Strategic Diversification: Allocating a portion of treasury to Bitcoin diversifies assets beyond traditional financial instruments, aiming to reduce overall portfolio risk and enhance returns. Long-Term Growth Potential: Despite volatility, Bitcoin has demonstrated remarkable long-term growth. Companies believing in the future of digital assets see Bitcoin as an investment with substantial upside potential. Pioneering Digital Transformation: Embracing Bitcoin signals a company’s commitment to innovation. For Metaplanet Bitcoin , this enhances its brand image and market appeal. These factors collectively paint a picture of a calculated and strategic pivot towards digital assets, driven by a desire for financial resilience and long-term value creation. The Broader Landscape: Institutional Bitcoin Adoption in Japan and Beyond Metaplanet’s substantial Metaplanet Bitcoin holdings are part of a larger, global trend of institutional adoption, but their move is particularly noteworthy within the Japanese context. Japan has historically been a significant player in the crypto space, known for its progressive regulatory framework. While the country has seen crypto exchanges and innovation, major traditional Japanese corporations have been slower to directly integrate Bitcoin into their treasury strategies compared to some Western counterparts. However, the tide is turning. Globally, companies like MicroStrategy have famously led the charge, accumulating vast amounts of Bitcoin. Their success has inspired others to consider similar strategies. In Japan, Metaplanet’s public and transparent approach to Bitcoin investment could serve as a powerful precedent, potentially encouraging other Japanese firms to explore similar avenues. This could accelerate institutional interest and investment within one of the world’s largest economies. Challenges remain, of course. Regulatory clarity, accounting standards, and volatility are hurdles. However, as the ecosystem matures with Bitcoin ETFs and improved custody solutions, the path for institutional adoption becomes smoother. Metaplanet’s bold step demonstrates that these challenges are surmountable and that the benefits of integrating Bitcoin into a corporate treasury can outweigh the perceived risks. What Does This Mean for the Future of Metaplanet Bitcoin and Crypto Markets? The continued accumulation of Bitcoin by companies like Metaplanet carries significant implications for both the individual firms involved and the broader cryptocurrency market. For Metaplanet, it solidifies their reputation as a pioneer in digital asset integration within a traditional corporate structure. Their strategic allocation could serve as a model for other Japanese companies, potentially paving the way for wider adoption across the nation’s corporate landscape. For the crypto market, particularly Bitcoin, such institutional investments provide several key benefits: Enhanced Legitimacy: When publicly traded companies make significant Bitcoin investments, it lends immense credibility to the asset class. Increased Stability: Institutional buying tends to be less reactive to short-term market fluctuations, contributing to greater market stability. Supply Shock Potential: As more institutions acquire and hold Bitcoin for long-term treasury purposes, the available supply on exchanges decreases. This sustained demand could drive up its price over the long term. Market Maturation: The involvement of sophisticated corporate treasuries encourages the development of more robust financial infrastructure around Bitcoin. For individual investors, Metaplanet’s actions serve as a powerful signal. While not financial advice, it highlights the growing trend of institutional confidence in Bitcoin. It suggests that diligent research into Bitcoin’s fundamentals and its role in a diversified portfolio may be increasingly warranted. Observing the strategies of major players like Metaplanet can offer valuable insights into long-term market trends and the evolving perception of digital assets. In conclusion, Metaplanet’s latest acquisition of 780 BTC is far more than just another transaction; it’s a strategic declaration. It underscores the increasing institutional conviction in Bitcoin’s enduring value and its role as a vital component of modern corporate treasuries. As a publicly traded Japanese company leading this charge, Metaplanet is not only fortifying its own financial position but also acting as a catalyst for broader institutional adoption within a key global economy. This move signals a profound shift in how corporations view and utilize digital assets, paving the way for a future where Metaplanet Bitcoin holdings are a common feature of robust balance sheets worldwide. The journey of Bitcoin from niche digital currency to institutional asset continues, with companies like Metaplanet lighting the way. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is Metaplanet and why are they investing in Bitcoin? A1: Metaplanet is a publicly traded Japanese company that has strategically adopted Bitcoin as a core treasury asset. They are investing in Bitcoin primarily to protect against inflation, diversify their assets, and capitalize on Bitcoin’s long-term growth potential, positioning themselves as a forward-thinking entity in the digital economy. Q2: How much Bitcoin does Metaplanet now hold after this acquisition? A2: Following the acquisition of an additional 780 BTC, Metaplanet’s total Bitcoin holdings have reached an impressive 117.132 BTC. This significant accumulation places them among leading institutional Bitcoin holders globally. Q3: What are the main reasons for institutional Bitcoin adoption? A3: Institutional adoption of Bitcoin is driven by several factors, including its role as an inflation hedge, its potential for long-term capital appreciation, portfolio diversification benefits, and the desire to embrace digital transformation and innovation within corporate treasury strategies. Q4: How does Metaplanet’s investment impact the broader crypto market? A4: Metaplanet’s substantial investment enhances Bitcoin’s legitimacy, potentially contributing to greater market stability due to less reactive institutional buying. It also highlights a growing trend of corporate confidence in digital assets, which could inspire other firms to follow suit and contribute to supply shocks as more Bitcoin is held off exchanges. Q5: Is Metaplanet the only Japanese company investing significantly in Bitcoin? A5: While other Japanese entities may have exposure to crypto, Metaplanet is currently one of the most prominent publicly traded Japanese companies making large, transparent Bitcoin treasury allocations. Their actions could set a precedent and encourage more institutional adoption within Japan’s corporate sector. Did you find this article insightful? Share it with your network to spread awareness about the evolving landscape of institutional Bitcoin adoption! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends , explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption. headline: Why Is Crypto Market Going Up Today? BNB Hits New ATH, XRP and ETH Surge
summary: The post Why Is Crypto Market Going Up Today? BNB Hits New ATH, XRP and ETH Surge appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The crypto market is rising again with Ethereum (ETH), XRP, and Binance Coin (BNB) posting stronger gains than Bitcoin in the last 24 hours. While Bitcoin is holding its ground above $119,000, it’s the altcoins that are making headlines today. According to CoinMarketCap, the total global crypto market cap now stands at $3.96 trillion, up 1.82% in the last day. Bitcoin dominance is starting to slide, allowing altcoins to shine. The Fear & Greed Index is currently at 67, showing that investor sentiment has firmly moved into the “Greed” zone. Ethereum Eyes $4,000 Breakout Ethereum is leading today’s rally, currently trading above $3,890, up over 3% in the last 24 hours. Traders believe ETH may soon cross the $4,000 mark if the momentum continues. An important resistance zone is between $4,200–$4,300, which could trigger the next wave of buying. BNB Hits New All-Time High BNB, the native token of Binance, is one of the strongest performers, jumping over 6% today and nearly 12% over the week to reach $851—a new all-time high. The move confirms that investors are rotating profits from Bitcoin into top-tier altcoins. Liquidity is spreading across the market, fueling short-term rallies across various tokens. XRP Follows with Solid Gains XRP also saw a healthy bullish trend, trading at $3.27 with over 5.8% weekly gains. While the Ripple vs SEC legal drama still lingers, market interest in XRP remains strong, partly due to ETF speculation and growing global adoption. What’s Driving the Market? Several factors are pushing the market higher: Bitcoin Weekly Close: BTC recently had its highest weekly close ever, reinforcing bullish sentiment. Macro Relief: The U.S. and China agreed to pause tariffs for 90 days, and the U.S. struck a trade deal with the EU, easing investor fears. USDT and BTC Dominance Falling: With stablecoin and Bitcoin dominance slipping, altcoins are attracting fresh capital. Positive Technicals: Many coins broke past resistance levels, setting the stage for potential breakouts. What’s Next? The analyst said that we are still in the middle of a bull cycle. The next major top to form around October or November, based on global liquidity trends and political timelines like the Crypto Market Structure Bill vote expected in September. For now, attention is on Ethereum to break $4,000, and Bitcoin’s next key target range is between $127,000 and $132,000. If the current altcoin trend continues, the broader market could soon test new highs.

headline: Crypto Futures Liquidation: Unpacking the Massive 24-Hour Market Shockwaves
summary: BitcoinWorld Crypto Futures Liquidation: Unpacking the Massive 24-Hour Market Shockwaves In the fast-paced world of digital assets, volatility isn’t just a buzzword; it’s a constant companion. Every day, millions of dollars shift hands, and fortunes can be made or lost in the blink of an eye. For those deeply entrenched in the derivatives market, especially perpetual futures , understanding the mechanics of market movements is paramount. Recently, the crypto space witnessed a significant event: a substantial crypto futures liquidation breakdown over a mere 24-hour period. These events are not just numbers; they represent forced closures of leveraged positions, sending ripples across the entire market. What exactly happened, and what crucial lessons can traders glean from this? What is Crypto Futures Liquidation and Why Does it Matter? Before diving into the numbers, let’s clarify what crypto futures liquidation truly entails. In essence, it’s the forced closure of a trader’s leveraged position by an exchange due to insufficient margin to cover potential losses. When you trade futures with leverage, you’re borrowing funds to amplify your potential gains – but also your potential losses. If the market moves significantly against your position, your collateral (margin) might fall below the exchange’s maintenance margin requirement. At this point, to prevent further losses for both the trader and the exchange, the position is automatically closed, or “liquidated.” Perpetual futures, unlike traditional futures contracts, have no expiry date. They use a funding rate mechanism to keep their price anchored to the spot price of the underlying asset. This makes them incredibly popular for speculative trading, but also amplifies the risks associated with leverage. A large liquidation event can trigger a cascade, as positions are closed, pushing prices further in the direction of the initial move, leading to more liquidations. This phenomenon is often referred to as a “liquidation cascade” or “liquidation squeeze.” The Recent 24-Hour Crypto Futures Liquidation Breakdown: Who Got Hit? The past 24 hours have provided a stark reminder of the market’s unforgiving nature, particularly for those with leveraged positions. Here’s a look at the significant figures from the recent crypto futures liquidation event: Cryptocurrency Total Liquidated (USD) Percentage of Short Positions Liquidated Bitcoin (BTC) $44.02 million 93.46% Short Ethereum (ETH) $69.21 million 80.99% Short VINE $9.41 million 79.25% Short These numbers reveal a compelling story. What’s particularly striking is the overwhelming percentage of short positions that were liquidated across Bitcoin, Ethereum, and VINE. This indicates that the market experienced a significant upward price movement within that 24-hour window, catching a large number of traders who were betting on prices to fall. When prices surge unexpectedly, short sellers face mounting losses. If their margin falls below the threshold, their positions are automatically closed, contributing to these liquidation figures. What Do These Crypto Futures Liquidation Figures Signal for Traders? The breakdown of these liquidation figures offers several critical insights for anyone involved in crypto trading: Market Sentiment Shift: A high percentage of short liquidations often suggests a sudden bullish momentum or a “short squeeze.” This happens when an upward price movement forces short sellers to buy back assets to cover their positions, further fueling the price increase. Increased Volatility: Liquidation events are a byproduct of, and also a contributor to, heightened market volatility. The forced selling (or buying, in the case of short liquidations) can create significant price swings. Risk of Cascade Effects: Large liquidations can trigger a domino effect. As one position is closed, it can push the price further, leading to more liquidations, creating a feedback loop that exacerbates price movements. Importance of Risk Management: These events underscore the absolute necessity of robust risk management strategies. Excessive leverage, without adequate collateral or stop-loss orders, is a recipe for disaster. Navigating the Storm: Actionable Insights for Trading with Crypto Futures Liquidation in Mind While liquidation events can be daunting, they also offer crucial lessons and opportunities for savvy traders. Here’s how you can better navigate the volatile landscape of crypto futures: Master Leverage Wisely: Leverage is a double-edged sword. While it can magnify profits, it equally amplifies losses. Understand your risk tolerance and use leverage judiciously. A common beginner mistake is using too much leverage, too soon. Implement Strict Risk Management: Stop-Loss Orders: Always set stop-loss orders to limit potential losses. This is your primary defense against unexpected market moves. Position Sizing: Never allocate too much of your portfolio to a single trade, especially a highly leveraged one. Determine your position size based on your risk capital. Diversification: While not directly applicable to a single futures trade, diversifying your overall crypto portfolio can cushion the blow of adverse movements in one asset. Monitor Liquidation Heatmaps: Some platforms provide tools that show “liquidation heatmaps,” indicating where large clusters of leveraged positions are concentrated. These can offer clues about potential price targets or areas of high volatility. Understand Funding Rates: For perpetual futures, funding rates can impact your profitability. Positive funding rates mean longs pay shorts, and negative means shorts pay longs. This influences the cost of holding a position. Stay Informed and Adapt: The crypto market is dynamic. Keep abreast of news, macroeconomic factors, and technical analysis. Be prepared to adapt your strategy as market conditions evolve. Remember, the goal isn’t to avoid all risk, but to manage it intelligently. Understanding the dynamics of crypto futures liquidation is a vital part of this process. Beyond the Numbers: The Psychology and Opportunities During Crypto Futures Liquidation While the immediate reaction to large crypto futures liquidation figures might be one of fear or caution, it’s also crucial to understand the broader implications and potential opportunities. Liquidation events are often characterized by extreme emotional responses in the market – fear, panic, greed, and euphoria. Traders caught on the wrong side experience significant stress, leading to impulsive decisions. Conversely, those who anticipate such movements or remain disciplined can find strategic entry or exit points. For instance, a massive short liquidation event, as we’ve just witnessed, can sometimes signal a temporary market bottom or a strong upward reversal. When a large number of short positions are forced to close, it creates significant buying pressure, propelling prices higher. This can be a “reset” for the market, flushing out over-leveraged positions and paving the way for more sustainable price action. Smart traders often look for these “flushing” events as potential indicators for market reversals, though this strategy comes with its own set of risks and requires careful confirmation. Furthermore, exchanges themselves benefit from liquidations through the collection of liquidation fees. While their primary role is to maintain market integrity, the process of liquidating positions generates revenue. This dynamic underscores the importance of exchanges having robust and fair liquidation engines that operate efficiently to protect both the market and its participants. Understanding the psychological undercurrents and how different market participants react to stress is as vital as technical analysis. It allows traders to avoid common pitfalls like FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) or FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, and Doubt) and instead, make more rational, data-driven decisions during periods of high volatility driven by crypto futures liquidation . Why Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness (EEAT) are Crucial in Understanding Crypto Futures Liquidation When discussing complex financial topics like crypto futures liquidation , the principles of EEAT (Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness) are more important than ever. In a market rife with misinformation and hype, relying on credible sources and understanding the underlying mechanisms is paramount. Our aim is to provide information that is: Expert: Based on a deep understanding of market mechanics, financial derivatives, and cryptocurrency trading. Authoritative: Drawing from real market data and established financial principles, rather than speculative rumors. Trustworthy: Presenting a balanced view of risks and opportunities, without promoting reckless trading behavior. By adhering to EEAT principles, we empower you with reliable knowledge to make informed decisions, rather than falling prey to emotional trading or unsubstantiated claims. Understanding how liquidations occur, their impact, and how to mitigate risks is a cornerstone of responsible trading. Conclusion: Navigating the Tides of Crypto Futures Liquidation The recent 24-hour crypto futures liquidation event serves as a powerful reminder of the inherent volatility and risks within the leveraged derivatives market. With millions of dollars in short positions wiped out across major assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum, it underscores the swift and often unpredictable nature of price movements. While these events can seem chaotic, they are fundamental to how leveraged markets self-correct and rebalance. For traders, the takeaway is clear: knowledge is your strongest asset. By understanding what triggers liquidations, how they cascade, and critically, how to implement robust risk management strategies, you can transform potential pitfalls into valuable learning experiences. The crypto market continues to evolve, offering both immense opportunities and significant challenges. Approaching it with a disciplined mindset, a clear strategy, and a commitment to continuous learning will be your ultimate guide through its exhilarating ups and downs. Stay informed, stay strategic, and trade responsibly. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) About Crypto Futures Liquidation Q1: What exactly is a perpetual futures contract? A1: A perpetual futures contract is a type of derivative that allows traders to speculate on the future price of an asset without an expiry date. Unlike traditional futures, they don’t settle physically. Instead, they use a “funding rate” mechanism to keep their price tethered to the underlying asset’s spot price, making them popular for continuous trading. Q2: Why do crypto futures liquidations occur? A2: Liquidations occur when a trader’s leveraged position loses too much value, and their margin (collateral) falls below the exchange’s required maintenance level. To prevent further losses for the trader and the exchange, the position is automatically closed by the exchange’s liquidation engine. This typically happens during periods of high volatility when prices move sharply against a trader’s bet. Q3: What does it mean when “short positions are liquidated”? A3: When short positions are liquidated, it means traders who were betting on the price of an asset to fall (shorting) have had their positions forcibly closed because the price unexpectedly rose significantly. This upward movement caused their losses to exceed their available margin. This phenomenon often contributes to a “short squeeze,” where forced buying to cover short positions further fuels the price increase. Q4: How can traders protect themselves from liquidation? A4: Traders can protect themselves by employing strict risk management strategies. Key methods include using appropriate leverage (avoiding excessive leverage), setting stop-loss orders to limit potential losses, maintaining sufficient margin in their accounts, and understanding market volatility. Position sizing and diversification are also crucial elements. Q5: Are liquidation events inherently bad for the crypto market? A5: While painful for individual traders, liquidation events are a natural and necessary part of leveraged markets. They help to “flush out” excessive leverage from the system, rebalance market sentiment, and can sometimes signal a temporary market bottom or a reversal. They are a mechanism for market self-correction, promoting healthier, albeit more volatile, price discovery in the long run. Did this breakdown of crypto futures liquidation provide you with valuable insights? Share this article with your fellow traders and crypto enthusiasts on social media to help them navigate the volatile world of derivatives trading more effectively! Your shares help us empower more individuals with crucial market knowledge. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Crypto Futures Liquidation: Unpacking the Massive 24-Hour Market Shockwaves first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Ethereum gears up for another test of the $4,000 mark
summary:
Fancy a break, mate? Amid the latest optimistic headlines on the trade front, cryptocurrencies are starting to come up again after a bit of a setback in the middle of last week. Over the weekend, we've seen a resurgence in Ethereum in particular as it wipes out the losses from Wednesday amid a drop towards $3,600.

As price now moves back up to its highest since December last year, the question once again is will we see a potential break of $4,000? That has been arguably the biggest level in stopping the price action breakout for Ethereum for the longest of time.

It was only one previously that we ever really saw a clean break for Ethereum above the key level and that was back in late 2021. That didn't last though, with the peak coming just above $4,800 before falling back. In similar vein, Bitcoin also broke to fresh record highs above $60,000 at the time before falling back to under $20,000 in the following summer. How the times have changed, eh?

Throughout last year, Ethereum failed to firmly break the $4,000 level. So, this will be one of its biggest tests yet. If buyers can seek a break here, the sky's the limit. Otherwise, another rejection might just mark the high we'll be seeing for the rest of the year.

But so far, the summer of crypto and the summer of collectibles continue to run hot across the globe.

This article was written by Justin Low at investinglive.com.

headline: What you share with ChatGPT could be used against you
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed concern that ChatGPT conversations lack legal privilege protection and could be subpoenaed in lawsuits.

headline: Coinbase sues man using a Coinbase-like URL to make money
summary: Coinbase has sued a man in Germany, accusing him of squatting on a domain with the exchange’s name to try to get the company to overpay for it.
